reviews.productTitle: Aiwode Rotating Dimmer Switch,Soldering Iron Temperature Control,Electric Fan„ÄÅFactory Electric Fan,Ventilation Fan,Power Controller,Desk Lamp,Dimming LED Light,UL Listed,White,Below 200W,Pack of 1.
reviews.text: Update: I use this with a strip of low voltage, dimmer-compatible, under-cabinet LED lights. The lights will occasionally, not frequently, blink (off-on) when controlled by this switch. This isn‚Äôt related to any other load kicking in or anything like that. I‚Äôve only used this switch in the lower half of its range so don‚Äôt know if the problem would occur throughout the dimmer range. I missed the return/exchange cutoff date, so I am living with it, which isn‚Äôt hard as it doesn‚Äôt hamper the work that‚Äôs being illuminated. Could be a flaw in just this particular unit, and I still like the switch. Originally: This is a nice, smoothly operating dimmer switch. I like the large rotary knob. I am using it with under cabinet LED light bars, and the switch seems to vary the light intensity over the entire range, 10-100% according to the light's manual, in a linear fashion. Funny thing, though‚Äîwhen I chose this unit I was happy to see from product photos that the neutral (wide) blade of the switch was on the right. This mean that for most electrical outlets, at least in the U.S., the switch would have to be plugged in upside down, with the receptacle for the device the switch was controlling pointing up. Some reviewers remarked that this was unfortunate, but for my application it was perfect. Now that I have the switch, I see that the manufacturer has reversed the plug orientation, probably in response to criticism, which probably will make 90 percent of customers happy. I opened the unit to see if the plug orientation could be easily reversed, but that does not seem to be the case. (I think that would be a cool feature to have. I now see that a diagram and a customer photo on the product page does show this wide-blade-on-the-left orientation, but as of this date the seller's product photos and videos still show the opposite.) So, I will be turning the receptacle in my outlet box over (for those who don't know, the electrical code does not specify that for households the orientation of receptacles has to be any specific way) so I can use this nice dimmer switch upside down, the way that will work better for me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2025
reviews.title: Nice dimmer switch. Mfr has reversed plug orientation.

reviews.text: Small "squirrel cage" fan - draws 75W/130VAR on low - and would not run at any setting on the knob. It was possible at the highest setting - if you were very careful - to get it to run - like a sweet spot on the dial. But that was intermittent and any other position would not work. It did power up a small table fan and worked fine for that. My other comment - has no ground - only 2 prong - so if you have a 3 prong plug you will have to get a "cheater" plug. My stove fan had 3 prongs - and even if it had worked I would have had some concerned about it.

reviews.text: I'm seriously impressed with these dimmers! I recently took on a project where I built a false stud wall with sconces for a video studio. The goal was to create some stylish back lighting without the hassle of wiring in traditional dimmer switches. That's where these dimmers came into play, and let me tell you, they were a game changer. I simply wired the lights behind the wall to a plug and connected them to this switch. The setup was a breeze ‚Äì no complicated wiring, no permanent alterations, just straightforward, effective lighting control. It's the perfect blend of simplicity and functionality. For anyone looking to add a touch of adjustable lighting without the usual fuss, these dimmers are the way to go!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.title: Worked perfect! Couldn't be happier!

reviews.text: This device does not work with energy saving bulbs (LED). It also doesn't work with the grow light. It only works with light bulbs that are Dimmable - Light Bulbs. Somehow it works strangely as if it reduces the voltage by 1/4 when turning. So if you expect to get smooth scrolling it won't happen. For example, if you connect a fan, you will not be able to set the speed you want, but it will go from about 25% 50% 75%. Note that you need special bulbs that are compatible and will allow you to set them to some 0% 25% 50% 75% 100% light. I am not impressed with this device.

reviews.title: I am not impressed with this device.

reviews.productTitle: Aiwode Rotating Dimmer Switch,Soldering Iron Temperature Control,Electric Fan„ÄÅFactory Electric Fan,Ventilation Fan,Power Controller,Desk Lamp,Dimming LED Light,UL Listed,White,Below 200W,Pack of 1.
reviews.text: DESCRIPTION This item is a general purpose dimmer for loads up to 200 Watts. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ASSEMBLY Plug your appliance into the dimmer, and plug the dimmer into an outlet. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî PLUS Simple and easy to use. Small size. There is an OFF setting with a definite click sound so you are sure the load is off. When turned down all the way, the lamp is still on a little, so you can tell it is still on. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî MINUS The dimmer is upside-down (the outlet is on the top) when I plug it into my outlets. My outlets are oriented the usual way with the ground pin on the bottom. The marking around the dial is two arrows, which is not the usual convention. I expected one gradually-increasing crescent to indicate more power. The indicator on the knob is a shallow groove and not too visible. I improved upon this by using a black Sharpie pen to make a line in the groove. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî HOW I USED IT I wanted a device to use with my hot pot, to reduce the heat to a simmer level. My hot pot has two power levels, 200W and 700W. Both levels boil water too much for simmering. I put some soup ingredients in the hot pot, set it for low (200 Watts), and plugged it into the dimmer. I turned the dimmer up all the way for the full 200 Watts. Once the soup began to boil, I backed the dimmer down to halfway. This simmered the soup nicely, with only an occasional bubble popping to the surface. Perfect! I also tried the dimmer on several lamps and it works as advertised. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî MY RATING 5 stars for doing its job well.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2022
reviews.title: Simple, small dimmer for lamps and small appliances

reviews.productTitle: Aiwode Rotating Dimmer Switch,Soldering Iron Temperature Control,Electric Fan„ÄÅFactory Electric Fan,Ventilation Fan,Power Controller,Desk Lamp,Dimming LED Light,UL Listed,White,Below 200W,Pack of 1.
reviews.text: I knew when i got this that it was designed for low current applications (no heaters or high wattage items) and it works well for what it's designed for. When used with a lamp having an incandescent bulb, it dims nicely to about 20% then goes dark. I wish it could dim lower but it's adequate. I also tried it with an LED rope light and it worked similarly; I was surprised because LEDs prefer PWM-style dimmers, not voltage dimmers, so presumably it has to do with the rope light's ability to handle it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.title: Works well for low-wattage incandescent lamps, some LEDs.

reviews.text: Same thing as another customer. Bought the thing, used it to dim incandescent christmas tree lights. It worked great!! Only for 2 days though. It now doesn't work, spinning the dial the lights sometimes flicker. But it doesn't do anything else. Lame
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on November 9, 2023
reviews.title: Broke after a couple days
